title: How long does an average performance of Carmina Burana last? - Quora

response.answer_text: Right around an hour, longer or shorter depending on the conductor’s tempi. If you haven’t listened to it, I definitely recommend it, even if you don’t have a translation handy. And even better if you can see it live (we had two performances in my area just last week!) because of the wall of sound you get from “O fortuna” alone. Also, I’m inclined to agree with Tim Ward that “In Taberna” is probably the greatest drinking song in any language. I’d love to see what song could beat it!

A bit over an hour. Fits neatly onto one CD. I’ve only ever seen it live once, about 20 years ago, in a great performance by the Minnesota Orchestra and Chorale. (I remember the bass solo hamming it up during “Ego Sum Abbas” and a raucous performance of “In Taberna Quando Sumus”, the greatest drinking song ever written in any language.
